uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.filter

Class SQLResultIterator<T,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.filter.FilterSelect<T>
      • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.filter.FilterReader<T,O>
        • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.filter.SQLResultIterator<T,O>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of filter
    O - Type of object produced.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.Iterator<O>, Contexed, CloseableIterator<O>, Targetted<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataObjectFactory.ReferenceIterator, ResultIterator

    public abstract class SQLResultIterator<T,O>
extends FilterReader<T,O>
implements CloseableIterator<O>
    Iterator over filter results based on the SQL parts of a filter *

    For large queries the results are generated in batches to reduce memory use. It is up to the calling method not to retain too many references to the generated objects.

    This is an CloseableIterator as it wraps jdbc AutoCloseables. It should close automatically when the iterator is exhausted. It also registers itself with the DatabaseService to be closed on AppContext cleanup if not explicitly closed before then.

    Note that where the filter implements more than one of the supported filter interfaces AcceptFilter, ConditionFilter, PatternFilter The iterator will return the intersection of the sets selected by each interface.

    The ResultMapper, target, source and order clauses are set as methods
